q: In the End, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.
h:
“In the End, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: Receive without complaint, Work with fate.
h:
“Receive without complaint, Work with fate.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: If you want to be successful, you have to jump, there's no way around it.
h:
“If you want to be successful, you have to jump, there's no way around it.” —
Steve Harvey

q: I am always doing what I cannot do yet, in order to learn how to do it.
h:
“I am always doing what I cannot do yet, in order to learn how to do it.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: No grand idea was ever born in a conference, but a lot of foolish ideas have died there.
h:
“No grand idea was ever born in a conference, but a lot of foolish ideas have died there.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself
h:
“When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself” —
Wayne Dyer

q: Instead of being intimidated by the limitations, be inspired to find new ways around them.
h:
“Instead of being intimidated by the limitations, be inspired to find new ways around them.” —
Ralph Marston

q: When people are free to do as they please, they usually imitate each other.
h:
“When people are free to do as they please, they usually imitate each other.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: If you don't make things happen then things will happen to you.
h:
“If you don't make things happen then things will happen to you.” —
Robert Collier

q: A minute's success pays the failure of years.
h:
“A minute's success pays the failure of years.” —
Robert Browning

q: All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream.
h:
“All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream.” —
Edgar Allan Poe

q: Sometimes things become possible if we want them bad enough.
h:
“Sometimes things become possible if we want them bad enough.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: It is the greatest of all mistakes to do nothing because you can only do little; do something.
h:
“It is the greatest of all mistakes to do nothing because you can only do little; do something.” —
Sydney Smith

q: Happiness cannot be traveled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed.
h:
“Happiness cannot be traveled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed.” —
Denis Waitley

q: Ideas do not reach perfection in a day, no matter how much study is put upon them.
h:
“Ideas do not reach perfection in a day, no matter how much study is put upon them.” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: You have the ability, now apply yourself.
h:
“You have the ability, now apply yourself.” —
Benjamin Mays

q: The goal of an artist is to create the definitive work that cannot be surpassed.
h:
“The goal of an artist is to create the definitive work that cannot be surpassed.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: We are all like the bright moon, we still have our darker side.
h:
“We are all like the bright moon, we still have our darker side. ” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish.
h:
“We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Our heart is a treasury; if you pour out all its wealth at once, you are bankrupt.
h:
“Our heart is a treasury; if you pour out all its wealth at once, you are bankrupt.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: Sometimes a change of perspective is all it takes to see the light.
h:
“Sometimes a change of perspective is all it takes to see the light.” —
Dan Brown

q: If you see someone without a smile give them one of yours.
h:
“If you see someone without a smile give them one of yours.” —
Unknown

q: We must not cease from exploration. And the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we began and to know the place for the first time.
h:
“We must not cease from exploration. And the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we began and to know the place for the first time.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: The more often a stupidity is repeated, the more it gets the appearance of wisdom.
h:
“The more often a stupidity is repeated, the more it gets the appearance of wisdom.” —
Voltaire

q: There are more quarrels smothered by just shutting your mouth, and holding it shut, than by all the wisdom in the world.
h:
“There are more quarrels smothered by just shutting your mouth, and holding it shut, than by all the wisdom in the world.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: We're responsible for everything that happens to us.
h:
“We're responsible for everything that happens to us.” —
Yanni

q: People with clear, written goals, accomplish far more in a shorter period of time than people without them could ever imagine.
h:
“People with clear, written goals, accomplish far more in a shorter period of time than people without them could ever imagine.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Don't change your mind just because people are offended; change your mind if you're wrong.
h:
“Don't change your mind just because people are offended; change your mind if you're wrong.” —
Criss Jami

q: It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.
h:
“It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: The greatest of all mistakes is to do nothing because you think you can only do a little.
h:
“The greatest of all mistakes is to do nothing because you think you can only do a little. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Success is getting what you want... Happiness is wanting what you get.
h:
“Success is getting what you want... Happiness is wanting what you get.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: The world would go on even without you. Don't take yourself so seriously.
h:
“The world would go on even without you. Don't take yourself so seriously.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Every experience is a lesson. Every loss is a gain.
h:
“Every experience is a lesson. Every loss is a gain.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: Work for something because it is good, not just because it stands a chance to succeed.
h:
“Work for something because it is good, not just because it stands a chance to succeed.” —
Vaclav Havel

q: Life goes by fast. Enjoy it. Calm down. It's all funny.
h:
“Life goes by fast. Enjoy it. Calm down. It's all funny.” —
Joan Rivers

q: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
h:
“By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
h:
“Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.” —
Thomas Edison

q: Man is affected not by events but by the view he takes of them.
h:
“Man is affected not by events but by the view he takes of them. ” —
Seneca

q: Being ignorant is not so much a shame, as being unwilling to learn.
h:
“Being ignorant is not so much a shame, as being unwilling to learn.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: There is no such thing as a great talent without great willpower.
h:
“There is no such thing as a great talent without great willpower.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees opportunity in every difficulty.
h:
“The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees opportunity in every difficulty.” —
Winston Churchill

q: Among the things you can give and still keep are your word, a smile, and a grateful heart.
h:
“Among the things you can give and still keep are your word, a smile, and a grateful heart.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: When the fish is caught we pay no more attention to the trap.
h:
“When the fish is caught we pay no more attention to the trap.” —
Huang Po

q: Do what you feel in your heart to be right - for you'll be criticized anyway.
h:
“Do what you feel in your heart to be right - for you'll be criticized anyway.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Do all things with love.
h:
“Do all things with love.” —
Og Mandino

q: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.
h:
“Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.” —
Aristotle

q: Singleness of purpose is one of the chief essentials for success in life, no matter what may be one's aim.
h:
“Singleness of purpose is one of the chief essentials for success in life, no matter what may be one's aim.” —
John D. Rockefeller

q: Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.
h:
“Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Why compare yourself with others? No one in the entire world can do a better job of being you than you.
h:
“Why compare yourself with others? No one in the entire world can do a better job of being you than you.” —
Unknown

q: Every defeat, every heartbreak every loss, contains its own seed, its own lesson on how to improve your performance the next time.
h:
“Every defeat, every heartbreak every loss, contains its own seed, its own lesson on how to improve your performance the next time.” —
Og Mandino
